title: 111_s3810
content: The Act may be cited as the "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" and includes a restriction on participation in offshore oil and gas leasing. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" mandates that leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf include a certification requirement. Lessees must annually certify to the Secretary of the Interior that they do not engage in activities subject to sanctions under the Iran Sanctions Act. Failure to comply may result in lease cancellation. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" requires lessees to annually certify to the Secretary of the Interior that they do not engage in sanctioned activities under the Iran Sanctions Act. Failure to comply may lead to lease cancellation. Additionally, the Secretary of the Interior must include a disclosure requirement in each lease issued after the enactment of the Act, mandating disclosure of any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" mandates lessees to disclose any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran that include persons blocked under Executive Orders 13224 and 13382. Failure to comply may result in lease cancellation. The Act requires lessees to disclose involvement with blocked persons under Executive Orders 13224 and 13382 or entities listed in appendix A to part 560 of title 31. The Secretary can cancel the lease if disclosure is false or not made. The Secretary can cancel a lease if a person fails to disclose involvement with blocked persons or entities listed in specific regulations. The Secretary may waive this requirement on a case-by-case basis if it is in the national interest, with reporting requirements in place. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if a person fails to disclose involvement with blocked persons or entities listed in regulations. Waivers can be granted on a case-by-case basis if in the national interest, with reporting requirements to congressional committees. The Secretary must promptly report any lease cancellations to the appropriate congressional committees. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to the House Committees on Natural Resources and Foreign Affairs. In this section, "appropriate congressional committees" refer to specific committees in the House and Senate. The term "person" is defined as in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. The Act will end 30 days after the President certifies to Congress that Iran has stopped supporting terrorism, pursuing weapons of mass destruction, and no longer poses a threat to US national security or allies.
